revised_title: Investigating the Cause and Symptoms of a Bovine Mortality in Venetian Territories
tldr: The author investigates a bovine mortality in Venetian territories and concludes that it is a malignant pestilential fever. He observes the thickened blood and various symptoms, such as refusal of food, difficulty breathing, and swollen heads and bellies. The author also examines the carcasses and finds differences in the blood and internal organs of affected cattle compared to healthy ones.
